result.name: quarterly-adoption-survey
result.notes:
The aim of the voluntary quarterly adoption survey is to collect data which will add to and complement the data currently collected through the annual data collection. This data will be used to monitor the impact of the adoption reform programme.

The survey collects child level information on the characteristics and timescales of those children that are at particular stages in the adoption process within the specified quarter. The survey also requested a small amount of aggregate-level information on prospective adopters.

organization.name: department-for-education
organization.title: Department for Education
organization.description:
The Department for Education is responsible for education and children’s services in England. We work to achieve a highly educated society in which opportunity is equal for children and young people, no matter what their background or family circumstances.
DfE is a ministerial department, supported by 9 agencies and public bodies.

https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/department-for-education

result.title: Voluntary Adoption Survey

extras.value:
The child level data collected in the survey is not published in its raw form as it contains data defined as personal and sensitive personal data by the Data Protection Act 1998. A ministerial letter at the start of the survey stated that no Local Authorities would be identified as part of the exercise. Reports of the national aggregated outputs are published on a regular basis. 

Last published 16 July 2013
